entity.name: Alex Lau (AvengerMoJo)
entity.description: Independent open-source developer with 25+ years in Linux/OSS, 15+ years leading engineering teams (up to 70 engineers), and recent LLM/AI consulting (built root-cause LLM search engines, reduced research time by 90% via open-source workflows). Solo-maintaining MoJoAssistant to safeguard human agency, privacy, and cognitive liberty in the accelerating AI era.

projects.name: MoJoAssistant
projects.description: Local-first cognitive firewall and internal proxy protecting users' private data, intent, and decision-making from public AI risks (scams, profiling, cognitive erosion, manipulation). Runs entirely on-device with perfect local memory (MCP), multi-layered embeddings, adversarial verification, and pedagogical explainability to teach digital self-reliance while enabling safe, utility-preserving access to powerful models. Aims to prevent large-scale fraud, preserve human sovereignty, and foster decentralized, human-centric AI futures.

plans.name: MoJoAssistant Core Safety & Acceleration Funding
plans.description: Supports part-time development of the safety-first prototype (adversarial scam verification, tamper-proof local memory, pedagogical UI for digital literacy), 6-month residency acceleration (Berlin + SF for contributor onboarding, meetups, red-teaming), on-device compute/hardware, and small community events. Targeting flexible support in the $45,000–$85,000 range over 18–24 months to harden protections, reach 10k–20k users, and demonstrate measurable impact on reducing AI-driven fraud and cognitive risks.
